Cell.Data: The DEV TEAM / MISC NOTES column contains info on what text between { } signs means (if applicable). It usually stands for either a numeric value, or a numeric value with an icon. Text between [ ] signs stands for a certain type of icon.

“The program continued to gather resources in the area. At first, there was no physical manifestation of the Malware Daemon, but soon a small holographic projector lifted and another flickered on and a small web of yellow light danced between them. A blue arc of electricity crackled from an improvised electrical arc buzzer. It darted across the line of automated defenses and stopped before attempting to transmit its consciousness. The gate swung open and the turret turned on the guards just inside the gate. We now had access to the complex.”— Haxor Jaxor, “RV-45003C: Your code-sharks have no bytes”
The Reconstructed Daemon is a small robotic automation with a Daemon inside, controlling it. Due to being built from the remains of a dead unit, the construction is flimsy.
Edit: Constructed -> Due to being built

“The Hacker said she fought for ultimate freedom. Apparently, that involves replacing your face with a virtual one. If she gets tired of her face, she searches a book of faces, replacing older models with newer models. She said Hackers eventually replace everything. She used implants to quicken her neural link to her network. Hackers achieve ultimate freedom by deploying code-constructs called Daemons to protect themselves and override conformist programming. The ultimate goal of the Synthesis is to achieve perfect mastery over all virtual worlds. That said, I think I’m happy with my boring face.”— Mah Reg’Nib, “RV-5580X: Forgotten Places”

“The Synthesis know that it’s basic military strategy to disrupt the enemy’s lines of communication. That’s why the more adept members never attack without the support of a mobile network node called a "Modified Type-A Network Link." If they turn our machinery against us, focus the assault on the link. Be careful, the link is protected with a gun turret. The link can reset the internal safety protocols of weaponry under its control. Synthesis Daemons are enhanced by the link as well, enabling them to shrug off counter-measures.”— Major Sherwood Gordon, “RV-30400M: Cyberwarfare”

“An assortment of machines followed the radiant face *[dongle*]. Propelled by their own motion servos, gesticulating limbs, drones, mech and *[deadly pound cakes*], the machines swarmed around *[General Moron*]. I tried to approach but my vehicle had already been compromised by the Avatar’s disruption viruses *[and my ugly face*]. None of the machines in the force appeared to be functioning to capacity, while the machines hijacked by the Synthesis activists gathered, awaiting the command *[to eat all the idiot-pills*]. I ordered my troops to *[wet themselves*].”— General *[Butt-Head Jerkface*], “RV-00000M: L33T Hackers 43V3r!*[System Record Compromised*]”

Changed '[]' into '*[*]' where the '[]' were intended to be displayed to the player - i.e. where it doesn't concern markup text. We need to be sure to change this in the localized text too, as this change was made after the text was send out for localization. Please remove this comment when the changes are made, but only after verifying this was done for all languages supported at launch.
